required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Blood Pressure and Metabolic Effects of Nebivolol in Hypertensive Patients With Impaired Glucose Tolerance or Impaired Fasting Glucose
clinical_study.official_title: Blood Pressure and Metabolic Effects of Nebivolol Compared With Hydrochlorothiazide and Placebo in Hypertensive Patients With Impaired Glucose Tolerance or Impaired Fasting Glucose

brief_summary.textblock: This study is being done to see if the blood pressure and metabolic effects of an approved drug nebivolol is comparable to that of another approved drug hydrochlorothiazide (HCTZ) and placebo in hypertensive patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
This study is double blind (neither you nor the physician will know when you are receiving placebo, which is an inactive compound such as a sugar pill, or active study drugs nebivolol or hydrochlorothiazide).
All participants will also receive lisinopril, an angiotensin converting enzyme, or losartan, an angiotensin receptor blocker. All medications are approved and marketed for the treatment of hypertension.This study is being conducted in about 500 patients at approximately 80 research centers in the United States.
The study consists of approximately 9 study visits over a period of 5 months. During these visits, patients will undergo routine health exams and some special laboratory tests such as an oral glucose tolerance test.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Visit 4 (Week 0) To Visit 8 (Week 12)
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Mean Seated Trough Cuff Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) at Week 12, Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma Glucose Level After an Oral Glucose Tolerance Test
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Visit 3 or 4 (Week -2 or 0) To Visit 8 (Week 12)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Plasma Glucose 2 Hours Post-oral Glucose 75 grams, given as part of an Oral Glucose Tolerance Test (OGTT). Last Observation Carried Forward.

arm_group.description: Nebivolol with concomitant losartan or lisinopril
HCTZ with concomitant losartan or lisinopril
Placebo with concomitant losartan or lisinopril

intervention.intervention_name: Nebivolol with concomitant losartan or lisinopril
intervention.description: Encapsulated Nebivolol 5 mg, 10 mg, 20, mg, 40 mg total daily dosage, oral administration with concomitant treatment consisting of lisinopril 10 mg total daily dosage, oral administration or losartan 50 mg total daily dosage, oral administration.

intervention.intervention_name: HCTZ with concomitant losartan or lisinopril
intervention.description: Encapsulated Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg or 25 mg total daily dosage, oral administration with concomitant treatment consisting of lisinopril 10 mg total daily dosage, oral administration or losartan 50 mg total daily dosage, oral administration.

intervention.intervention_name: Placebo with concomitant losartan or lisinopril
intervention.description: Placebo with concomitant treatment consisting of lisinopril 10 mg total daily dosage, oral administration or losartan 50 mg total daily dosage, oral administration.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, ambulatory outpatients 18-80 years old at screening.
- Have a history of hypertension and taking up to 2 medications for high blood pressure.
- Qualifying laboratory results confirming impaired fasting glucose or impaired glucose tolerance
- Vision and hearing (hearing aid permissible) sufficient for compliance with questionnaire completion
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have clinically significant respiratory, liver or cardiovascular disease
- Presence of coronary artery disease requiring treatment with a beat blocker, calcium channel blocker or nitrates
- Use of niacin or antidiabetic drugs (oral or injectable) within 6 months before study entry
- Have a history of hypersensitivity to nebivolol, other beta-blockers, hydrochlorothiazide, or other sulfonamide-derived drugs.

overall_official.affiliation: Forest Research Institute, a subdisiary of Forest Laboratories, Inc.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: May 2008 to March 2010 at 96 US sites, 72 sites randomized patients.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A losartan or lisinopril run-in phase was required for all patients before assignment to Placebo or Nebivolol or Hydrochlorothiazide arms.

group.title: Nebivolol
group.description: Encapsulated Nebivolol 5 mg, 10 mg, 20, mg, 40 mg total daily dosage, oral administration with concomitant treatment consisting of lisinopril 10 mg total daily dosage, oral administration or losartan 50 mg total daily dosage, oral administration

group.description: Encapsulated Hydrochlorothiazide 12.5 mg or 25 mg total daily dosage, oral administration with concomitant treatment consisting of lisinopril 10 mg total daily dosage, oral administration or losartan 50 mg total daily dosage, oral administration.

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo with concomitant treatment consisting of lisinopril 10 mg total daily dosage, oral administration or losartan 50 mg total daily dosage, oral administration.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Sponsor Terminated due to PI oversight

group.title: Nebivolol
group.description: Encapsulated Nebivolol 5 mg, 10 mg, 20, mg, 40 mg total daily dosage, oral administration with concomitant treatment consisting of lisinopril 10 mg total daily dosage, oral administration or losartan 50 mg total daily dosage, oral administration

class.title: Patients greater than or equal to 65 years of age.

outcome.title: Trough Seated Diastolic Blood Pressure
outcome.description: Change from Baseline in Mean Seated Trough Cuff Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) at Week 12, Last Observation Carried Forward (LOCF).
outcome.time_frame: Change from Baseline Visit 4 (Week 0) To Visit 8 (Week 12)
outcome.population: The between–treatment-group comparison was performed by means of an analysis-of-covariance model with treatment group and study center as factors and baseline value as a covariate based on Intent-to-Treat (ITT) population. As pre-specified in the protocol, the change in seated DBP was performed between the nebivolol and placebo group.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All data generated in this study will be the property of Forest Research Institute. An integrated clinical and statistical report will be prepared at the completion of the study. Publication of the results by the Investigator will be subject to mutual agreement between the Investigator and Forest Research Institute.
